content.paragraph1: We cannot find the page you’re looking for.
content.subHeading: What you can do
content.paragraph2: If you typed the web address, check it’s correct.
content.paragraph3: If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.
content.paragraph4: You can also go back to the service you were trying to use and start again. You can look for the service using your search engine or find it from the GOV.UK homepage.

content.subHeading: What you can do

content.paragraph1En: GOV.UK One Login is unavailable right now.
content.paragraph2En: Try refreshing this page. If you still see this message, try again later.
content.paragraph3En: You can also go back to the service you were trying to use. You can find it using a search engine or from the GOV.UK homepage.

typesOfPhotoId.paragraph1: For the GOV.UK One Login app, you can use a:
typesOfPhotoId.paragraph2: You can use an expired BRP, BRC, or FWP up to 18 months after its expiry date with the GOV.UK One Login app only.
typesOfPhotoId.paragraph3: At a Post Office, you can use a:
postOfficeDocumentList: National identity card from the EU, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein
typesOfPhotoId.paragraph4: At a Post Office, your photo ID must not have expired, unless you have a UK passport. You can use a UK passport up to 18 months after its expiry date.

content.paragraph1: You cannot go back if you’ve already started entering information to prove your identity online.
content.subHeading: What you can do
content.paragraph2: Continue proving your identity online.

pyiNoMatch.title: Sorry, we cannot confirm your identity
pyiNoMatch.header: Sorry, we cannot confirm your identity

content.paragraph1: We could not find a match when we checked your details with another organisation.
content.paragraph1Nino: We could not find a match for your National Insurance number when we checked your details with HMRC.
content.paragraph1BankAccount: We could not find a match when we checked your details with your bank or building society.
content.paragraph2: To keep your information safe, we cannot tell you which of your details we were unable to match.
content.insetTextRepeatFraudCheck: You will not be able to use your GOV.UK One Login to access the service.
content.subHeading: What you can do
content.paragraph3: You can go back to the service you were trying to use to find out if there are other ways to access it.
content.paragraph3UpdateDetails: You can continue to the service without updating your details. Your proof of identity is valid even if your details have changed.
content.paragraph3RepeatFraudCheck: You can go back to the service you were trying to use. There may be another way to access the service without using your GOV.UK One Login.

content.subHeading: If you do not have photo ID
content.paragraph1: You can try proving your identity with the service you need to use. They may take other types of ID.
content.paragraph2: If you have photo ID, you can prove your identity online by:
list: using the GOV.UK One Login app
entering the details from your UK passport or UK photocard driving licence and answering security questions
content.paragraph3: You can also prove your identity at a Post Office.

content.paragraph2: Make sure your driving licence does not have any dirt or scratches on it.

pyiTriageSelectSmartphone.headerMam: Tell us what smartphone you are using now

content.paragraph1: To prove your identity with the GOV.UK One Login app, you need a smartphone with a working camera.
content.paragraph2: This must be an iPhone 8 or newer, or an Android phone.

details.summaryText: How do I know which iPhone I have?
details.html:
The iPhone 8 was released in 2017. If you bought your iPhone after 2017, you probably have an iPhone 8 or newer.

To check which iPhone you have, go to your phone settings. Select ‘General’ then ‘About’ and look for the ‘Model Name’.

content.subHeading1Dad: Do you have access to an iPhone or Android phone?

content.h3GoBackToTheService: Go back to the service you’re trying to use

content.paragraph4: You can contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in new tab).

pagePreExperianKbvTransition.title: Answer security questions

content.paragraph1: We’ll ask you some security questions that only you should know the answers to.
content.paragraph2: This will help us stop anyone else who might have your details from pretending to be you.
content.paragraph3: The questions will be about your financial history, such as your mobile phone contract, bank account, and any credit cards, loans or mortgages you have.
content.paragraph4: We will not keep your answers or share them with any other organisation.
content.paragraph5: You will find the questions easier to answer if you have information about your financial history to hand.

pagePreExperianKbvTransition.warningTextContent: Do not guess the answer if you do not know it. You cannot change your answers and you cannot skip any questions.
pagePreExperianKbvTransition.summaryText: How we know what questions to ask you
pagePreExperianKbvTransition.summaryHtml:
We’ll work with Experian (opens in a new tab) to make sure we ask you questions that only you can answer. This is because companies like Experian have access to lots of information that we can check your answers against.

We’ll only ask you questions about information that Experian already has.

Read our privacy notice (opens in a new tab) if you’d like to know more about how your details will be used to prove your identity.

pageF2fHandoff.title: Finish proving your identity at a Post Office
pageF2fHandoff.header: Finish proving your identity at a Post Office

content.subHeading1: Get your Post Office customer letter
content.paragraph1: You’ve been sent a confirmation email with a link to download your customer letter.
content.paragraph2: If you’ve asked us to, we’ll also send your customer letter to you by post. It can take up to 6 working days for your letter to arrive.
content.subHeading2: Go to a Post Office by
content.paragraph3: When you go to a Post Office, you must take:
whatToBringToPostOffice: the photo ID shown on your customer letter
content.paragraph4: A member of Post Office staff will:
content.paragraph5: If you do not go to a Post Office by the date shown on your customer letter, you’ll need to start proving your identity again.
content.detailsTitle: Which Post Office should I go to?
content.detailsContent:
Your Post Office customer letter shows which Post Office you chose to go to.

You can go to a different Post Office as long as it offers in-branch verification (opens in new tab).

You do not need to contact the GOV.UK One Login team if you want to go to a different Post Office.
content.paragraph6: The result of your identity check will usually be available within 24 hours of going to the Post Office.
content.paragraph7: When it’s ready, you’ll get an email from GOV.UK One Login. You can view your result by signing in.

content.paragraph1: Deleting the details saved in your GOV.UK One Login will not affect any other government account you may have, such as Government Gateway or Universal Credit.

confirmDetails.title: You need to confirm your details
confirmDetails.header: You need to confirm your details

content.paragraph1: To keep your GOV.UK One Login secure, you need to confirm the details you gave us when you proved your identity.
content.detailsTitle: If there is a mistake in your name
content.detailsContent:
Contact the GOV.UK One Login team if there is a mistake in your name. For example, if your name is missing letters or a hyphen.

Do not try to update your details unless the GOV.UK One Login support team has told you to.

Contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in new tab).

updateNameDateBirth.headerReuse: You cannot update your full name or date of birth
updateNameDateBirth.headerRfcAccountDeletion: You cannot update your full name or date of birth

content.paragraph1: To update your full name or date of birth, you need to contact the GOV.UK One Login team.
content.paragraph1Reuse: This is to help protect you from identity fraud.
content.paragraph1RfcAccountDeletion: This is to help protect you from identity fraud.
content.paragraph2: You can still use the service if your details are out of date.
content.paragraph3: To use a different full name or date of birth, you’ll need to delete your GOV.UK One Login and create a new one.
content.warningText: You may not be able to use your GOV.UK One Login if your details are not up to date.
content.radioButtonHeading: What would you like to do?

formRadioButtons.yes: Contact the GOV.UK One Login team to update your full name or date of birth
formRadioButtons.yesReuse: Continue to the service without updating your details
formRadioButtons.yesHintReuse: Your proof of identity is valid even if your details have changed.
formRadioButtons.yesHintRfcAccountDeletion: Then create a new one and prove your identity with your new details.
formRadioButtons.no: Go back and check your details again
formRadioButtons.noHint: You might be able to update your details yourself if you only need to update either your first or middle names, or your last name.
formRadioButtons.noHintReuse: Then create a new one and prove your identity with your new details.

pyiDetailsDeleted.title: You have deleted the details in your GOV.UK One Login
pyiDetailsDeleted.header: You have deleted the details in your GOV.UK One Login

content.paragraph1: You’ve been sent a confirmation email.
content.paragraph2F2f: Your Post Office customer letter is no longer valid and you should not try to use it to prove your identity.
content.paragraph2: You can now prove your identity again using your new details.
content.paragraph3F2f: You can now try to prove your identity another way.
content.paragraph3: You’ll need:
requirements: photo ID with the name you want GOV.UK One Login to use
to tell us where you’ve lived for the last 3 months
content.paragraph4F2f: Find out about the different ways to prove your identity with GOV.UK One Login (opens in new tab).
content.paragraph4: Find out what photo ID you can use to prove your identity (opens in new tab).
content.submitButtonText: Continue to prove your identity again

content.paragraph1: If you no longer want to prove your identity at a Post Office, you can delete your details and try to prove your identity another way.
content.paragraph2: Find out about the different ways to prove your identity with GOV.UK One Login (opens in new tab).
content.insetText: After you’ve deleted your details, your Post Office customer letter will no longer be valid and you should not try to use it to prove your identity.
content.paragraph3: We will automatically delete your details if you do not go to the Post Office within 10 days of getting your confirmation email.
content.paragraph4LinkText: I want to prove my identity at a Post Office

content.paragraph1: You can continue proving your identity online by entering details from any of the following:
requirements: UK photocard driving licence (full or provisional)
requirementsNino: UK photocard driving licence (full or provisional)
content.paragraph2: You’ll also need to answer some security questions. We use these to stop anyone who might have your details from pretending to be you.
content.paragraph3: It takes about 10 minutes to prove your identity this way.
content.subHeading: How would you like to prove your identity?

formRadioButtons.continueDrivingLicenceButtonText: Enter your UK driving licence details

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select what you would like to use to prove your identity
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select what you would like to use to prove your identity

pageIpvReuse.title: You have already proved your identity
pageIpvReuse.header: You have already proved your identity

content.paragraph1: You have already proved your identity with GOV.UK One Login. You would have done this online or in person at the Post Office.
content.paragraph2: You can now continue to the service you need to use.
content.subHeading: Check your details
content.paragraph3: You submitted the following details when you proved your identity. You might want to check your details are still correct if you’ve not signed in to GOV.UK One Login in a while.
content.paragraph4: Some of these details might be used to automatically fill in the forms within the service you need to use.

updateUserDetailsInformation.updateDetailsHtml:
If your details have changed

Your proof of identity is still valid even if your details have changed.

You do not need to update your details to continue to the service you need to use.

When you continue, GOV.UK One Login will share your saved details with the service.

If you need to, you can update your details.

If there is a mistake in your name

Contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in new tab) if there is a mistake in your name. For example, if your name is missing letters or a hyphen.

Do not try to update your details or prove your identity again unless the GOV.UK One Login team has told you to.

pageIpvPending.title: You have not finished proving your identity
pageIpvPending.header: You have not finished proving your identity

content.paragraph1: You need to go to a Post Office that offers in-branch verification to finish proving your identity.
content.paragraph2: You should have received a confirmation email explaining what to take with you and what will happen at the Post Office. Check the letter in your confirmation email.
content.subHeading: If you’ve already been to the Post Office
content.paragraph3: Your identity check is still being processed.
content.paragraph4: You’ll get an email when there’s a result for your identity check - usually within a day of going to the Post Office.
content.subHeading2: If you want to prove your identity another way
content.paragraph5: If you no longer want to prove your identity at a Post Office, you can delete your details and try to prove your identity another way.
content.paragraph6: We will automatically delete your details if you do not go to the Post Office within 10 days of getting your confirmation email.
reasonsToContact: need help to finish proving your identity with the Post Office
would prefer not to go to the Post Office and want to prove your identity another way

pageIpvSuccess.title: Continue to the service you need to use
pageIpvSuccess.header: Continue to the service you need to use

content.paragraph1: You’ve successfully proved your identity. You can now continue to the service you need to use.
content.paragraph1RepeatFraudCheck: We’ve checked your details. You can now continue to the service you need to use.
content.paragraph1UpdateIdentity: We’ve checked your details. You can now continue to the service you need to use.
content.paragraph2: Some of the information you shared when you proved your identity might be used to automatically fill in forms within the service.

pageIpvIdentityDocumentStart.title: Tell us if you have one of the following types of photo ID
pageIpvIdentityDocumentStart.header: Tell us if you have one of the following types of photo ID

content.paragraph: This will help us find the best way for you to prove your identity.
content.subHeading: UK passport
content.paragraph2: You can use any UK passport if it has not expired.
content.subHeading2: Non-UK passport with a biometric chip
content.paragraph3: You can use a non-UK passport if it:

details1.summaryText: Has your passport got a biometric chip?
details1.paragraph4: To check if your passport has a biometric chip, look for the rectangular biometric chip symbol on the front cover.

content.imgAltText: The front cover of a passport with the biometric chip symbol enlarged.
content.paragraph5: You can use a UK driving licence if it:
content.paragraph6: It can be a full or provisional UK driving licence.
content.subHeading4: UK biometric residence card or permit
content.paragraph7: You can use a biometric residence permit (BRP), biometric residence card (BRC) or a Frontier Worker permit (FWP) if:
requirements: it’s up to 18 months after its expiry date
content.subHeading5: Do you have any of these types of photo ID ready to use?
content.hint: It must be a real document. You cannot use a photocopy or digital copy.

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select yes if you have any of these types of photo ID ready to use
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select yes if you have any of these types of photo ID ready to use

content.paragraph1: You can use any UK passport if it has not expired.
content.subHeading2: Non-UK passport with a biometric chip
content.paragraph2: You can use a non-UK passport if it:
content.paragraph3: To check if your passport has a biometric chip, look for the rectangular biometric chip symbol on the front cover.
content.imgAltText: The front cover of a passport with the biometric chip symbol enlarged.
content.paragraph4: You can use a UK driving licence if it:
content.paragraph5: It can be a full or provisional UK driving licence.
content.subHeading4: UK biometric residence card or permit
content.paragraph6: You can use a biometric residence permit (BRP), biometric residence card (BRC) or a Frontier Worker permit (FWP) if:
cardOrPermitRequirements: it’s up to 18 months after its expiry date

pageIpvIdentityPostofficeStart.title: Prove your identity at a Post Office with one of the following types of photo ID
pageIpvIdentityPostofficeStart.header: Prove your identity at a Post Office with one of the following types of photo ID

content.paragraph1: If you have any of the following types of photo ID, you can prove your identity at a Post Office.
content.subHeading: European Union (EU) photocard driving licence
content.paragraph2: You can use an EU driving licence if:
euDrivingLicenceRequirements: it is a plastic photocard, not a paper or handwritten licence
the address on it is the same as your current address (if it has an address)
content.paragraph3: You can use a non-UK passport as long as it has not expired.
content.subHeading3: National identity card from the EU, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein
content.paragraph4: You can use a national identity card from the EU, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein if:
eeaNationalIdentityCardRequirements: it is a plastic photocard, not a paper or handwritten card
the address on it is the same as your current address (if it has an address)
content.subHeading4: Do you have any of these types of photo ID?

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select what you would like to do
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select what you would like to do

proveIdentityNoPhotoId.title: Prove your identity with bank or building society details and security questions
proveIdentityNoPhotoId.titleNino: Prove your identity with your National Insurance number and security questions
proveIdentityNoPhotoId.header: Prove your identity with bank or building society details and security questions
proveIdentityNoPhotoId.headerNino: Prove your identity with your National Insurance number and security questions

content.paragraph1: You can use any current account with a UK bank or building society to prove your identity. Your name must be on the account.
content.subHeading: Provide some personal details
content.paragraph2: We’ll ask you for your:
content.paragraph2Nino: As well as your National Insurance number, we also need your:

personalDetails.name: name
personalDetails.address: current address (you might also need your previous address if you’ve recently moved)

content.paragraph3: We’ll then ask you some security questions. This helps us check if the details you’ve given are being used by you.
content.paragraph3Nino: We’ll then ask you some security questions. We use these to stop anyone who might have your details from pretending to be you.
content.subHeading3: Do you have a UK bank or building society current account in your name?
content.subHeading3Nino: Do you have a National Insurance number?

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select yes if you have a UK bank or building society account in your name
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select yes if you have a UK bank or building society account in your name
formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionTextNino: Select yes if you have a National Insurance number
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessageNino: Select yes if you have a National Insurance number

pyiPostOffice.title: Prove your identity at a Post Office
pyiPostOffice.header: Prove your identity at a Post Office

content.paragraph1: You may be able to prove your identity at a Post Office instead.
content.paragraph2: You’ll be asked to:
postOfficeTodo: enter details from your photo ID on GOV.UK
go to a Post Office where they’ll scan your ID and take a photo of you
content.paragraph3: This will take longer than proving your identity online. You’ll usually get a result within a day of going to the Post Office.
content.subHeading: Types of photo ID you can use at a Post Office
content.paragraph4: You’ll need one of the following:
postOfficeRequirements: a UK photocard driving licence (full or provisional)
a European Union (EU) photocard driving licence
a national identity card from the EU, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein
content.subHeading2: Do you have photo ID you can use at a Post Office?

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select yes if you have photo ID you can use at a Post Office
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select yes if you have photo ID you can use at a Post Office

pyiTriageDesktopDownload.title: Use the GOV.UK One Login app to prove your identity
pyiTriageDesktopDownload.header: Use the GOV.UK One Login app to prove your identity

content.paragraph1: The GOV.UK One Login app works by matching your face to your photo ID.
content.paragraph2: First you will need to download, open and use the app. Then you will come back to this page to finish proving your identity.
content.subHeading1: 1. Download the GOV.UK One Login app
content.paragraph3: You can download the GOV.UK One Login app by using the camera on your phone to scan the QR code.
content.warningText: The app uses a face scan with flashing colours
content.qrCodeAlt: QR code to download the app
content.subHeading2: Help using the GOV.UK One Login app

details1.summaryText: How to scan the QR code
details1.list2: Open the camera app on your phone.
details1.list3: Move your camera so the QR code is all clearly visible on your screen.
details1.list4: Tap the link that appears on your screen. This will go to App Store (iPhone) or Play Store (Android).
details1.list5: Download the GOV.UK One Login app.

details2.summaryText: How to download the app without a QR code
details2.list2: On your phone, open the App Store (for iPhone) or Play Store (for Android).
details2.list3: Search for the ‘GOV.UK One Login’ app.
details2.list4: Download the GOV.UK One Login app.

details3.summaryText: I am sensitive to flashing colours
details3.html:
The face scan checks that you’re a real person. It uses different colours that change less than 3 times per second.

You can prove your identity another way if you think you might be sensitive to flashing colours.
details3.htmlAppOnly:
The face scan checks that you’re a real person. It uses different colours that change less than 3 times per second.

If you think you might be sensitive to flashing colours and do not want to use the app, you may not be able to prove your identity. Check what you can do instead.

details4.summaryText: Do I need to take off my glasses?
details4.html:
When you scan your face, you can keep your glasses on as long as they’re not tinted.

If you wear tinted glasses, you’ll need to remove them when you scan your face.

details5.summaryText: I’d prefer not to use the app
details5.html:
You can read about how to use the app (opens in a new tab) if you’re not sure you can use it.

If you’d prefer not to use the app, you may be able to prove your identity another way.
details5.htmlAppOnly:
You can only prove your identity using the app.

You can read about how to use the app (opens in a new tab) if you’re not sure you can use it.

Check what you can do if you cannot use the app.

content.subHeading3: 2. Open the GOV.UK One Login app
content.paragraph4: Follow the instructions in the app to prove your identity.
content.paragraph5: If we successfully match your face to your photo ID, you’ll finish proving your identity online.
content.paragraph6: Then you can continue to the government service you want to use.

initial.spinnerStateText: Waiting for you to open the app. Keep this page open while you do this.

complete.paragraph2: You can now finish proving your identity online.

longWait.paragraph1: Once you’ve submitted your information in the app, it can take a few minutes to finish checking your details.
longWait.paragraph2: Do not close or refresh this page.

spinner.ariaButtonEnabledMessage: Completed. You can now finish proving your identity online.

pyiTriageMobileDownload.title: Use the GOV.UK One Login app to prove your identity
pyiTriageMobileDownload.header: Use the GOV.UK One Login app to prove your identity

content.paragraph1: If you already have the app installed, open it now.
content.paragraph2: The GOV.UK One Login app works by matching your face to your photo ID.
content.paragraph3: There will be instructions on what you need to do at each step.

details1.summaryText: The app uses a face scan with flashing colours
details1.html:
The face scan checks that you’re a real person. It uses different colours that change less than 3 times per second.

You can prove your identity another way if you think you might be sensitive to flashing colours.
details1.htmlAppOnly:
The face scan checks that you’re a real person. It uses different colours that change less than 3 times per second.

If you think you might be sensitive to flashing colours and do not want to use the app, you may not be able to prove your identity. Check what you can do instead.

details2.html:
1. Tap the ‘Download GOV.UK One Login’ button to go to the App Store (for iPhone) or Play Store (for Android).
  2. Download the GOV.UK One Login app.

details3.summaryText: Do I need to take off my glasses?
details3.html:
When you scan your face, you can keep your glasses on as long as they’re not tinted.

If you wear tinted glasses, you’ll need to remove them when you scan your face.

details4.summaryText: I’d prefer not to use the app
details4.html:
You can read about how to use the app (opens in a new tab) if you’re not sure you can use it.

If you’d prefer not to use the app, you may be able to prove your identity another way.
details4.htmlAppOnly:
You can only prove your identity using the app.

You can read about how to use the app (opens in a new tab) if you’re not sure you can use it.

Check what you can do if you cannot use the app.

pyiTriageBuffer.title: Are you sure you want to try to prove your identity another way?
pyiTriageBuffer.header: Are you sure you want to try to prove your identity another way?

content.paragraph1: There are other ways to prove your identity with GOV.UK One Login. The app may be the most suitable way if you have photo ID.

formRadioButtons.heading: What would you like to do?
formRadioButtons.anotherWay: Try to prove your identity another way
formRadioButtons.anotherWayHint: If you change your mind and want to use the app, you’ll have to start again.
formRadioButtons.back: Go back and use GOV.UK One Login app

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select what you would like to use to prove your identity
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select what you would like to use to prove your identity

pageUpdateName.title: Update your name using the GOV.UK One Login app
pageUpdateName.header: Update your name using the GOV.UK One Login app

content.paragraph1: To update your name, you need to prove your identity again.
content.paragraph2: You’ll need:
content.list1: photo ID with the name you want GOV.UK One Login to use
content.list2: to tell us where you’ve lived for the last 3 months
content.warningText: If you’re updating your last name, your photo ID must show the same given names you used when you last proved your identity, including any middle names.
content.paragraph3: Find out what photo ID you can use to prove your identity (opens in new tab).

nameMistakeInformation.summary: If there is a mistake in your name
nameMistakeInformation.text:
Contact the GOV.UK One Login team if there is a mistake in your name. For example, if your name is missing letters or a hyphen.

Do not try to update your details unless the GOV.UK One Login support team has told you to.

Contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in new tab)

content.subHeading1: If you need to use the service now
content.paragraph4: Your proof of identity is still valid even if your details are out of date.
content.paragraph5: You can use your saved details to access the service you need to use.
content.subHeading2: What would you like to do?

formRadioButtons.updateDetailsButtonText: Update your name using the GOV.UK One Login app
formRadioButtons.continueServiceButtonText: Continue to the service you were trying to use
formRadioButtons.continueServiceButtonTextRepeatFraudChec: Continue to the service you were trying to use to find out if there are other ways to access it
formRadioButtons.continueServiceButtonTextHint: You can update your details later.
formRadioButtons.continueServiceButtonTextHintRepeatFraud: You will not be able to use your GOV.UK One Login to use the service.
formRadioButtons.goBackButtonText: Go back and check your details again

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select what you would like to do
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select what you would like to do

cannotUseInformation.summary: If you cannot use the GOV.UK One Login app
cannotUseInformation.text:
Contact the GOV.UK One Login team if you cannot use the app.

You may need to delete your GOV.UK One Login. Then you can create a new one and try to prove your identity again with your new details.

Contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in new tab).

content.paragraph: We use security questions as the last step in checking your identity.
content.paragraph2: The questions are about information that’s personal to you. This stops other people from pretending to be you.
content.paragraph3: The questions use information from the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP).
content.paragraph4: You must answer enough questions correctly to prove your identity. You can then continue to the service you need to use.
content.subHeading: Before you start
content.paragraph5: You’ll need information from the bank or building society account that your PIP is paid into.
content.paragraph6: You can get this information from your:
content.paragraph7: You may also need the letter from the DWP saying that you were awarded PIP.

details.html:
We will not keep your answers to the security questions or share them with the service you need to use.

If you’d like to know more about how your details will be used to prove your identity, read our privacy notice (opens in a new tab).

content.paragraph8LinkText: I need to prove my identity another way

personalIndependencePayment.title: Tell us if you get Personal Independence Payment (PIP)
personalIndependencePayment.header: Tell us if you get Personal Independence Payment (PIP)

content.paragraph: If you get PIP then we’ll ask you security questions about your payments.
content.paragraph2: If you do not get PIP or would prefer not to say then you’ll need to prove your identity another way.

details.text: PIP is a benefit paid to some people who have a long-term health condition or disability.

content.subHeading: Do you get Personal Independence Payment (PIP)?

content.paragraph1Passport: Enter your UK photocard driving licence details and answer security questions.

documentList: national identity card from the EU, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein

content.paragraph: Based on what you’ve told us, you cannot prove your identity another way with GOV.UK One Login.

formRadioButtons.backButtonTextPassport: Go back and try to prove your identity with your UK passport

content.paragraph1Html: When you continue, you’ll be able to permanently delete your GOV.UK One Login. Find out <a class="govuk-link" rel="noopener" target="_blank" href="https://www.gov.uk/guidance/deleting-your-govuk-one-login">what happens when you delete your GOV.UK One Login (opens in new tab)<a>.
content.paragraph2: After you delete your GOV.UK One Login, go back to the service you were trying to use. You can then create a new GOV.UK One Login and prove your identity with your new details.
content.paragraph2ReproveIdentity: After you delete your GOV.UK One Login, go back to the service you were trying to use. You can then create a new GOV.UK One Login.

weMatchedYouToYourOneLogin.title: We’ve matched you to your GOV.UK One Login
weMatchedYouToYourOneLogin.header: We’ve matched you to your GOV.UK One Login

content.paragraph: You can now set up a new way to get security codes.

youCanChangeSecurityCodeMethod.title: You can change how you get security codes
youCanChangeSecurityCodeMethod.header: You can change how you get security codes

content.paragraph1: We need to check your identity before you change how you get security codes. This is to keep your information safe.
content.paragraph2: You’ll need a smartphone and photo ID to prove your identity.
content.subHeading: What you need to do
list: Answer some questions about your photo ID and the device you’re on. This is to make sure you can use the GOV.UK One Login app.
We’ll tell you how to download and use the app to prove your identity with your photo ID.
We’ll check your photo ID matches your GOV.UK One Login.
Choose how you want to get security codes. You can have codes sent to a mobile phone number or get them from an authenticator app.
Continue to the service you need to use.

details.label: I need to access GOV.UK One Login another way
details.content: You will not be able to change how you get security codes, but you may be able to use the method you already have set up. Check what you can do.

content.p1: There’s an issue with GOV.UK One Login.
content.p3: You can also prove your identity with the GOV.UK One Login app.
content.p4: Or you can prove your identity at a Post Office. This option takes longer. You’ll usually get an outcome within a day of going to the Post Office.
content.p4KbvCriError: Or you can prove your identity at a Post Office. This option takes longer. You’ll usually get an outcome within a day of going to the Post Office.
content.p4F2fCriError: Or you can prove your identity by answering some security questions online.
content.subHeading2: What would you like to do?

details.title: What do I need to use the app?
details.p1: You’ll need access to a phone with a working camera.
details.p2: If you’re using an iPhone, it must be:
details.p3: For an Android phone (for example, Samsung or Google Pixel), it must be running Android 10 or higher.
details.p4: You’ll get guidance on how to download and use the app.

formRadioButtons.app: Prove your identity with the GOV.UK One Login app
formRadioButtons.appHint: You’ll be shown how to download and use the app.
formRadioButtons.postOffice: Prove your identity at a Post Office
formRadioButtons.postOfficeHint: You’ll enter details from your photo ID on GOV.UK first.
formRadioButtons.postOfficeHintKbvCriError: You’ll enter some details on GOV.UK first.
formRadioButtons.webRoute: Prove your identity by answering some security questions
formRadioButtons.webRouteHint: You’ll enter details from your UK passport or UK photocard driving licence first.
formRadioButtons.returnToRp: Go back to the service you were trying to use to find out if there are other ways to access it

formErrorMessage.title: There is a problem
formErrorMessage.description: Select what you would like to do
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select what you would like to do

content.p1: It looks like you started proving your identity using a different web browser to the one you’re using now.
content.subHeading: What you need to do
content.p2: Continue using this browser and follow the instructions.
content.p3: When prompted, sign in to your GOV.UK One Login to finish proving your identity.

needMoreInformationConfirmChangeDetails.title: We need more information to confirm your change of details
needMoreInformationConfirmChangeDetails.header: We need more information to confirm your change of details

content.paragraph1: We could not confirm your change of details.
content.paragraph2RepeatFraudCheck: If you have a valid passport, you can prove your identity in the GOV.UK One Login app.
content.paragraph2UpdateDetails: You can continue to the service without updating your details. Your proof of identity is valid even if your details have changed.
content.paragraph3RepeatFraudCheck: Your passport must have the name you want GOV.UK One Login to use.
content.paragraph3UpdateDetails: Or you can use a valid passport to prove your identity in the GOV.UK One Login app. Your passport must have the name you want GOV.UK One Login to use.
content.paragraph4: Then we’ll try to confirm your details again.

details1.summaryText: How do I know if my passport is valid?
details1.paragraph5: You can use any UK passport if it has not expired.
details1.paragraph6: You can use a non-UK passport if it:
details1.paragraph7: To check if your passport has a biometric chip, look for the rectangular biometric chip symbol on the front cover.

content.imgAltText: The front cover of a passport with the biometric chip symbol enlarged.
content.subHeading1: What would you like to do?

formRadioButtons.passport: Use your passport to prove your identity in the GOV.UK One Login app
formRadioButtons.passportHint: You’ll be shown how to download and use the app.
formRadioButtons.returnToRp: Go back to the service you were trying to use
formRadioButtons.returnToRpHint: There may be another way to access the service without using your GOV.UK One Login.
formRadioButtons.continueToService: Continue to the service without updating your details
formRadioButtons.continueToServiceHint: Your proof of identity is valid even if your details have changed.

content.paragraph1: To prove your identity using the GOV.UK One Login app, you’ll need:
content.list2: a phone with a working camera
content.paragraph2Html: Find out what photo ID and phone you need to prove your identity using the app (opens in new tab).

details.title: If you cannot use the GOV.UK One Login app
details.p1: You can delete your GOV.UK One Login.
details.p2: Then you can create a new GOV.UK One Login and prove your identity another way.

needIdProveIdentityAgainApp.title: You need photo ID to prove your identity using the GOV.UK One Login app
needIdProveIdentityAgainApp.header: You need photo ID to prove your identity using the GOV.UK One Login app

content.paragraph1: You need one of the following types of photo ID:
content.list2: non-UK passport with a biometric chip
content.list4: UK biometric residence card or permit
content.paragraph2: If you cannot prove your identity using the app, you should delete your GOV.UK One Login. Then you can create a new one.
content.subHeading1: What would you like to do?

formRadioButtons.useApp: Prove your identity using the app and photo ID

formRadioButtons.returnToRpHint: You will not be able to use your GOV.UK One Login to use the service.
